intro: Sherbournia brazzaei, commonly known as the Brazza's ericoid, is a flowering plant native to the Democratic Republic of the Congo. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen shrub form. The plant features small, leathery leaves and produces clusters of white or pale pink flowers. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is typically found in moist, shaded forest environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
